ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] I need advise please
ygData.msgSnippet: hmmm, i thought they made the bolts stackable, prolly remembering wring and 50k??? thats nutty, im at ~158 with a 20k investment (and I m a nec with a cha of
ygData.messageBody:
hmmm, i thought they made the bolts stackable, prolly remembering wring

and 50k???
thats nutty, im at ~158 with a 20k investment (and I'm a nec with a cha of
55)
----- Original Message -----
From: Madgrizzle <MadGrizzle@...>
To: <EQ_Tinkering@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, February 02, 2001 4:20 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] I need advise please


> You skill level is at least 50. All gnomes start with that. Go to
> www.tinkering.org and check out the information there. If money is an
> issue, then don't even bother. I've dumped over 50,000pp into it so
> far. Only have skill of 158. Regardless, make lanterns until
> trivial. That's the first item to make.
>
> Atinky Eveready
>
> At 08:58 PM 2/2/2001 +0000, you wrote:
> >I would like to know exactly what item i should start tinkering first
> >to raise my level. I am currently a 16 Gnome Rogue, and have made
> >(albeit with a few failed attemps) fishing poles, fire water, 1 cam,
> >flameless lanterns, and 1 mechanical lockpick. I have seen the
> >trivial message with lanterns, fishing poles, and fire water. I know
> >my skill level is around 26-28, and i dont want to spend any more
> >money then i have to.
> >
> >Thanx
> >Varios
> >
> ><note> Gnomish Bolts are shockingly expensive, and non-stackable
> >items suck.
> >
> >
>
>
>
>
>
